aave.name: Token
aave.description: AAVE token has fixed supply (no mint function) behind an upgradeable proxy controlled by governance. Unlike most governance tokens, AAVE has absolutely no minting mechanism.

criteria.name: Fixed Supply - AAVE Token
criteria.description: No mint() function exists anywhere in the AAVE token codebase. Total supply is set at initialization and cannot be increased. This is the gold standard for token economics.

evidences.title: BaseAaveToken.sol:22
evidences.comment: uint256 internal _totalSupply; - No mint() function exists

criteria.name: No Minter Role - AAVE Token
criteria.description: Unlike most governance tokens, AAVE has absolutely no minting mechanism. No MINTER_ROLE, no mint function, no inflation pathway.

evidences.title: aave-token-v3/src
evidences.comment: grep search returns zero results for mint or MINTER

criteria.name: Proxy Upgradeability - AAVE Token
criteria.description: Token is behind InitializableAdminUpgradeabilityProxy. Upgrade rights should be held by governance timelock. Not immutable but governance-controlled.

evidences.title: AaveTokenV3.sol:7-11
evidences.comment: contract AaveTokenV3 is BaseAaveTokenV2, BaseDelegation

aave.name: Value Accrual Mechanism
aave.description: AAVE token does not receive direct protocol revenue at the token level. Value accrual occurs through staking mechanisms (Safety Module via ERC-4626 vaults) and governance rights. GHO generates revenue through interest and GSM fees flowing to treasury.

criteria.name: Staking Yield - ATokenVault
criteria.description: ERC-4626 vault allows yield generation on deposited assets. Standard composable vault pattern for staking.

evidences.title: ATokenVault.sol:29
evidences.comment: contract ATokenVault is ERC4626Upgradeable, OwnableUpgradeable

criteria.name: Fee Distribution - GSM
criteria.description: GSM swap fees are programmatically distributed to GHO treasury. Cannot be redirected without governance action.

evidences.title: Gsm.sol:280-287
evidences.comment: function distributeFeesToTreasury() - IERC20(GHO_TOKEN).transfer(_ghoTreasury, accruedFees)

criteria.name: Vault Fee Control
criteria.description: Vault owner can set fees on yield (up to 100% per _setFee constraint). Owner should be governance-controlled.

evidences.title: ATokenVault.sol:414-417
evidences.comment: function setFee(uint256 newFee) public override onlyOwner

aave.name: Protocol Revenue Ownership
aave.description: Protocol fees flow to a governance-controlled Collector (treasury) contract. Revenue sources include reserve factor, flashloan premiums, and liquidation protocol fees. All flows are programmatic and enforced at protocol level.

criteria.name: Fee Destination - Reserve Factor
criteria.description: Reserve factor percentage of interest accrues to treasury. Programmatic, cannot be bypassed.

evidences.title: ReserveLogic.sol:181-206
evidences.comment: function _accrueToTreasury - reserve.accruedToTreasury += amountToMint

criteria.name: Fee Destination - Flashloan Premiums
criteria.description: Flashloan fees accrue directly to reserve treasury. Hardcoded destination.

evidences.title: FlashLoanLogic.sol:226-229
evidences.comment: reserve.accruedToTreasury += params.totalPremium.rayDiv(...)

criteria.name: Fee Destination - Liquidation Fees
criteria.description: Protocol liquidation fees transfer directly to treasury address. Immutable per AToken deployment.

evidences.title: LiquidationLogic.sol:369-375
evidences.comment: vars.collateralAToken.transferOnLiquidation to RESERVE_TREASURY_ADDRESS()

criteria.name: Treasury Address Immutability
criteria.description: Treasury destination is immutable per AToken deployment. However, the treasury contract itself is upgradeable and FUNDS_ADMIN_ROLE can redirect funds from treasury.

evidences.title: AToken.sol:33
evidences.comment: address public immutable TREASURY

aave.name: Treasury Ownership
aave.description: The Collector contract is the protocol treasury. It is governance-controlled via FUNDS_ADMIN_ROLE with no backdoors for fund extraction.

criteria.name: Treasury Access Control
criteria.description: Only FUNDS_ADMIN_ROLE can transfer, approve, or create payment streams. Should be governance timelock (requires verification).

evidences.title: Collector.sol:24,33
evidences.comment: contract Collector - bytes32 public constant FUNDS_ADMIN_ROLE = 'FUNDS_ADMIN'

criteria.name: Revenue Splitter Immutability
criteria.description: When used, revenue split recipients and percentages are immutable. Cannot be changed after deployment.

evidences.title: RevenueSplitter.sol:16-34
evidences.comment: address payable public immutable RECIPIENT_A/B; uint16 immutable SPLIT_PERCENTAGE

aave.name: Protocol Ownership
aave.description: Aave V3 uses a sophisticated multi-role ACL system with granular permissions. Emergency powers are limited to pause/freeze operations. Contracts are upgradeable but admin is governance-controlled.

criteria.name: Multi-Role Access Control
criteria.description: Granular role separation prevents single point of control. Different roles for pool admin, emergency, risk, asset listing. AAVE holders indirectly control these addresses via governance.

evidences.title: ACLManager.sol:14-20
evidences.comment: POOL_ADMIN_ROLE, EMERGENCY_ADMIN_ROLE, RISK_ADMIN_ROLE, etc.

criteria.name: Emergency Powers - Pause Only
criteria.description: Emergency admin can only pause/freeze operations. Cannot withdraw funds, upgrade contracts, or change fee destinations. Grace period capped at 4 hours.

evidences.title: PoolConfigurator.sol:470-478
evidences.comment: function setPoolPause(bool paused, uint40 gracePeriod) onlyEmergencyOrPoolAdmin

criteria.name: Protocol Upgradeability
criteria.description: Core contracts are behind upgradeable proxies. Admin is immutable (set to PoolAddressesProvider) but owner can upgrade implementations. Requires governance verification.

evidences.title: BaseImmutableAdminUpgradeabilityProxy.sol:16-25
evidences.comment: contract BaseImmutableAdminUpgradeabilityProxy - address internal immutable _admin

aero.name: Token
aero.description: For aero, we have unbounded supply, but the contract is immutable, the minter role is given to an immutable minter contract that mints tokens on a predefined schedule that can only be changed by the DAO in small fixed increments.

criteria.name: Mint controlled by DAO
criteria.description: Minter role is given to governance-controlled contracts. Token minting requires DAO approval.

criteria.name: Immutable Token
criteria.description: Token contract is not upgradeable. No proxy pattern.

criteria.name: Fixed Supply
criteria.description: Rebasing mechanism protects veAERO holders from direct dilution

criteria.name: Deterministic Supply
criteria.description: Minter is immutable and controls the emission schedule

aero.name: Value Accrual Mechanism
aero.description: Stake AERO to veAERO, which grants LP fees. veAERO holders can also receive bribes. LP fees come from the pools, which are run by the DAO.

criteria.name: Protocol Fees
criteria.description: veAERO gets 100% of fees

criteria.name: External fees (Bribes)
criteria.description: External incentives flow to veAERO holders

criteria.name: Flywheel
criteria.description: Locked tokens reduce effective circulation. Not full burn but indirect value accrual via reduced supply and the veAERO lock rate.

aero.name: Protocol Revenue Ownership
aero.description: Fees flow directly to Voters, they do not hit an intermediate treasury. The Fees can be updated by the fee manager who cannot change WHERE the fee can go but they can potentially zero the fee.

criteria.name: Fee destination
criteria.description: Fee path: Pool → PoolFees → Gauge → FeesVotingReward → Voters

evidences.title: Pool.sol:377-378
evidences.comment: fees calculated as amountIn * getFee() / 10000

criteria.name: Revenue protection
criteria.description: Fee destinations cannot be changed but the team address can set the fee to zero. However, fee cap to team is hardcoded immutable at 5%.

aero.name: Protocol Ownership
aero.description: Aerodrome contracts are immutable. Most fee conditions are light-touch permissions which do not affect token holder revenue streams. The fee to zero is the main exception. There are no emergency powers to access funds.

criteria.name: Protocol Immutability
criteria.description: Contracts are non-upgradeable

criteria.name: Onchain Governance
criteria.description: ProtocolGovernor (15-min delay, 1-week voting, 4% quorum) and EpochGovernor for emission adjustments. NO FUND EXTRACTION: No sweep functions or backdoors to steal funds

lido.name: Token
lido.description: LDO token contract is immutable but has a controller (TokenManager) with mint/burn capabilities. Supply is unbounded but minting requires governance approval.

criteria.name: Token Contract Immutability
criteria.description: The LDO token contract itself is not upgradeable. No proxy pattern deployed.

evidences.title: MiniMeToken
evidences.comment: Deployed without proxy pattern

criteria.name: Unbounded Supply - Mint Function
criteria.description: Controller can mint unlimited tokens to any address. Controller is TokenManager. MINT_ROLE on TokenManager is given to Voting contract (LDO token holders decide). Minting path: Voting → TokenManager → Token.generateTokens(). No cap on supply.

evidences.title: MiniMeToken.sol
evidences.comment: function generateTokens(address _owner, uint _amount) onlyController returns (bool)

criteria.name: Burn Function
criteria.description: Controller can burn tokens from any address. Currently BURN_ROLE is given to no one, but permission manager is Voting contract. To enable burning, proposal must go through Agent to call setPermission on ACL.

evidences.title: MiniMeToken.sol
evidences.comment: function destroyTokens(address _owner, uint _amount) onlyController

criteria.name: TokenManager Upgradeability
criteria.description: TokenManager is upgradeable via Aragon proxy pattern. Full upgrade path requires governance flow: Voting → DualGovernance → EmergencyProtectedTimeLock → Executor → Agent → Kernel.setApp(). LDO holders control upgrades.

evidences.title: TokenManager
evidences.comment: Deployed via Aragon AppProxyUpgradeable

lido.name: Value Accrual Mechanism
lido.description: LDO token itself does not directly accrue protocol fees. Value accrual is through governance rights over protocol treasury and fee parameters.

criteria.name: Governance Rights
criteria.description: LDO holders have governance power over protocol decisions, fee allocations, and treasury management. Indirect value accrual through protocol growth and governance.

evidences.title: Voting contract
evidences.comment: Voting contract controls Agent which controls treasury and protocol parameters

criteria.name: Dual Governance Protection
criteria.description: stETH holders can veto LDO governance decisions via Escrow mechanism. Prevents hostile LDO majority from harming stETH holder interests. Aligns token holder interests.

lido.name: Protocol Revenue Ownership
lido.description: Fees are set per staking module (currently 10% of staking rewards split between treasury and module). Fee changes require full governance flow.

criteria.name: Fee Destination
criteria.description: Fees set per staking module. Currently 7 modules, each with treasuryFee + stakingModuleFee = 1000 (10%).

evidences.title: StakingRouter.sol
evidences.comment: function addStakingModule with _stakingModuleFee and _treasuryFee parameters

criteria.name: Fee Change Protection
criteria.description: To change fees, full governance flow required: Voting → DualGovernance → EmergencyProtectedTimeLock → Executor → Agent → StakingRouter. LDO holders majority must approve, stETH holders can veto.

evidences.title: STAKING_MODULE_MANAGE_ROLE
evidences.comment: Given to Agent contract

criteria.name: Treasury Fee Flexibility
criteria.description: Fees are not immutable. Governance can change fee percentages and distribution. However, changes require LDO majority and survive stETH veto period.

evidences.title: updateStakingModule
evidences.comment: function can modify fees

lido.name: Treasury Ownership
lido.description: Treasury controlled by Agent contract, which is controlled by governance flow.

criteria.name: Treasury Access Control
criteria.description: Agent's EXECUTE_ROLE permission manager is Agent itself. EXECUTE_ROLE given to Executor contract. Full governance flow required for treasury actions: Voting → DualGovernance → EmergencyProtectedTimeLock → Executor → Agent. LDO holders control treasury via governance.

lido.name: Protocol Ownership
lido.description: Protocol upgrades and parameter changes require multi-step governance flow with Dual Governance veto protection.

criteria.name: Governance Flow
criteria.description: All significant protocol changes require: Voting (LDO holders) → DualGovernance (stETH veto window) → EmergencyProtectedTimeLock (time delay) → Executor → Agent → Protocol Contracts. LDO holders have ultimate control, constrained by stETH veto.

criteria.name: Validator Exit Risk
criteria.description: During congestion, validator exits can be delayed weeks/months. In this window, hostile LDO majority could theoretically force contract upgrades. Dual Governance veto mechanism mitigates but doesn't fully eliminate this risk.

lido2.name: Governance
lido2.description: Governance control mechanisms for Lido protocol

evidences.title: Governance 1
evidences.comment: Voting (LDO holders) → [DualGovernance (stETH veto window)](https://etherscan.io/address/0xC1db28B3301331277e307FDCfF8DE28242A4486E#code) → [EmergencyProtectedTimeLock (time delay)](https://etherscan.io/address/0xCE0425301C85c5Ea2A0873A2dEe44d78E02D2316#code) → [Executor](https://etherscan.io/address/0x23E0B465633FF5178808F4A75186E2F2F9537021#code) → [Agent](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3e40D73EB977Dc6a537aF587D48316feE66E9C8c) → Protocol Contracts. LDO holders have ultimate control, constrained by stETH veto.

evidences.title: Governance 2
evidences.comment:
Lido Easy Track is an optimistic governance system for routine, low-risk LDO DAO operations.

Key Workflow Mechanics:
1. Whitelisted proposers (node ops, committees) create "motions" for predefined actions like staking limit increases or grants top-ups.
2. Motions pass automatically unless ≥0.5% LDO objects within 72 hours.
3. Permissionless execution post-timelock if unopposed; rejected motions escalate to full Aragon vote.
4. Max 20 active motions; emergency dev multisig pause available.

[Easy Track Interface](https://easytrack.lido.fi/) | [Easy Track Guide](https://docs.lido.fi/guides/easy-track-guide)

criteria.name: Role Accountability
criteria.description: All critical roles flow through governance-controlled contracts, ensuring LDO holders maintain ultimate control over the protocol.
criteria.evidences:
**Voting:**
Voting contract is controlled by LDO holders.

**Agent:**
EXECUTE_ROLE is given to Executor. Executor is owned by EmergencyProtectedTimeLock, which is controlled by DualGovernance, which is controlled by Voting contract.

**TokenManager:**
MINT_ROLE is given to Voting contract.
BURN_ROLE is given to no one as of now, but its permission manager is Voting contract.

**StakingRouter:**
STAKING_MODULE_MANAGE_ROLE is given to Agent contract.

Since Agent is only callable by Governance 1, all operations are controlled by LDO holders.

criteria.name: Upgrade Sovereignty
criteria.description: The LDO token contract is immutable with no proxy pattern. However, it has a `controller` address (TokenManager) that can call privileged functions(`generateTokens`, `destroyTokens`, `enableTransfers`, `claimTokens`). Additionally, the token's doTransfer function includes a hook that calls the controller contract, which is upgradeable. Since TokenManager is upgradeable via Aragon proxy, the token's behavior can be modified through controller upgrades, making LDO Token partially upgradeable in practice.

evidences.title: LDO Token
evidences.comment: Token contract deployed without proxy pattern

evidences.title: TokenManager
evidences.comment: TokenManager is an Aragon App V1 proxy linked to a [Kernel contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb8FFC3Cd6e7Cf5a098A1c92F48009765B24088Dc). Upgrading TokenManager requires calling setApp(tokenManager, ...) on the Kernel, which is protected by `APP_MANAGER_ROLE`. This role is assigned to the Agent contract, ensuring all TokenManager upgrades flow through Governance 1

criteria.name: Supply Sovereignty
criteria.description: The LDO token's controller (TokenManager) can mint unlimited tokens. However, minting requires MINT_ROLE on TokenManager, which is held by the Voting contract. This enforces the minting path: Voting (LDO holders) → TokenManager → Token.generateTokens(). No supply cap exists, but all mints require tokenholder approval.

evidences.title: MiniMeToken.sol
evidences.comment: function generateTokens(address _owner, uint _amount) onlyController returns (bool)

criteria.name: Censorship Immunity
criteria.description: Controller can burn tokens from any address and enable/disable transfers. Currently, `BURN_ROLE` on the TokenManager is given to no one, but permission manager is Voting contract. To enable burning, proposal must go through Governance 1 to call `setPermission` on [ACL](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9895F0F17cc1d1891b6f18ee0b483B6f221b37Bb).

evidences.title: MiniMeToken.sol
evidences.comment: Burning Tokens: function destroyTokens(address _owner, uint _amount) onlyController

evidences.title: MiniMeToken.sol
evidences.comment: Enable/Disable Transfers: function enableTransfers(bool _transfersEnabled) onlyController

criteria.name: Upgrade Sovereignty
criteria.description: The protocol contracts can be upgraded by the Agent contract(hence, by LDO holders)

evidences.title: StakingRouter
evidences.comment: proxy_getAdmin is set to Agent

evidences.title: Agent
evidences.comment: Uses Aragon v1 Proxy and upgrading requires calling `setApp(Agent, ...)` on the Kernel which requires APP_MANAGER_ROLE(currently given to Agent itself). Hence, upgrade is controlled by LDO holders

evidences.title: DualGovernance, Executor, EmergencyProtectedTimeLock
evidences.comment: These contracts are NOT upgradeable

evidences.title: StakingRouter
evidences.comment: Users funds that have been deposited into Lido's buffered ETH can only be deposited into a staking module by [DepositSecurityModule](https://etherscan.io/address/0xfFA96D84dEF2EA035c7AB153D8B991128e3d72fD#code) which is controlled by Guardians

lido2.name: Value Accrual
lido2.description: Value accrual mechanisms for token holders

criteria.name: Accrual (Not Active)
criteria.description: LDO token holders currently have no direct value accrual mechanism from protocol revenue. However, governance is exploring buyback mechanisms to return value to token holders, with proposals under consideration for liquid buyback execution using protocol treasury funds.

evidences.title: Liquid Buybacks Research
evidences.comment: Governance proposal discussing buyback mechanisms for LDO token holders

criteria.name: Treasury Ownership
criteria.description: The [Lido contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6ca84080381e43938476814be61b779a8bb6a600#code) allows users to send ETH to the contract by `submit` function and contract puts the funds into buffered eth and mints the according shares to the user. Later on, [DepositSecurityModule](https://etherscan.io/address/0xfFA96D84dEF2EA035c7AB153D8B991128e3d72fD#code) calls `deposit` function on the Lido contract and decides in which staking module to put the buffered ETH. [StakingRouter](https://etherscan.io/address/0xfddf38947afb03c621c71b06c9c70bce73f12999) is where each staking module can be added and updated (currently, there're [7 modules](https://lido.fi/how-lido-works/protocol-fee)). When staking module is added, caller passes what treasury and stakingModule fee must be.

evidences.title: Lido.sol
evidences.comment: The treasury fees from staking module is routed to treasury, which is controlled by LDO holders

criteria.name: Mechanism Control
criteria.description: To add a new staking module or update it with new fees, full governance flow required, hence controlled by LDO holders.

evidences.title: Add
evidences.comment: Adding a new staking module(including fees) is given to STAKING_MODULE_MANAGE_ROLE holder

evidences.title: Update
evidences.comment: Updating the staking module(including fees) is given to STAKING_MODULE_MANAGE_ROLE holder

criteria.name: IP Ownership (Brand)
criteria.description: European trademark registrations and the UK IPO Trademark Journal list the Lido Labs BORG Foundation (a memberless entity) as the owner, rather than the DAO or tokenholders directly.

criteria.name: IP Ownership (NPD)
criteria.description: There is no specific legal disclosure provided indicating that tokenholders have direct legal rights to patents or trade secrets; governance control is indirect through the BORG structure.

criteria.name: Distribution (Website)
criteria.description: While the DAO oversees the BORG, there is no public filing explicitly confirming the domain is legally owned by a tokenholder-governed entity rather than the Foundation or an individual.

criteria.name: Distribution (Socials)
criteria.description: Public research indicates the Lido DAO has defined governance controls over the BORG structure, which include overseeing the administrative channels and primary infrastructure.

uni.name: Token
uni.description: UNI has a fixed initial supply of 1 billion tokens with algorithmic inflation capped at 2% per year. The token contract is immutable with no proxy patterns. Minting is controlled by a single minter address which should be verified as the governance Timelock.

criteria.name: Immutable Token
criteria.description: Plain contract with no proxy patterns, no delegatecall, no EIP-1967/UUPS patterns

criteria.name: Mint controlled by DAO
criteria.description: Minter role exists; must verify on-chain that minter = Timelock (0x1a9C8182C09F50C8318d769245beA52c32BE35BC)

evidences.title: Uni.sol mint function
evidences.comment: Requires verification that minter is governance Timelock

criteria.name: Inflation Cap
criteria.description: uint8 public constant mintCap = 2; - hardcoded 2% maximum of total supply per mint

criteria.name: Mint Interval
criteria.description: uint32 public constant minimumTimeBetweenMints = 1 days * 365; - minimum 365 days between mints

criteria.name: Deterministic Supply
criteria.description: Initial supply 1B tokens at constructor; inflation schedule is algorithmic with hardcoded constraints

uni.name: Value Accrual Mechanism
uni.description: UNI is primarily a governance token. There is no programmatic value accrual at the token contract level (no staking, no fee distribution, no buyback). Value accrual comes through governance influence over the fee switch.

criteria.name: Protocol Fees to Holders
criteria.description: No receive(), stake(), or distribute() functions in Uni.sol. Fee routing is controlled by governance votes, not programmatic distribution

evidences.title: Uni.sol
evidences.comment: No direct code reference at token level

criteria.name: Governance Rights
criteria.description: UNI holders vote on fee switch activation and fee routing. Quorum: 4% (40M UNI), Proposal threshold: 1% (10M UNI)

criteria.name: Fee Switch Activation
criteria.description: Fee switch can ONLY be activated via UNI governance vote, not by Uniswap Labs. Potential future cash flow via governance decisions. Recent governance proposals (2025-2025) have addressed activating protocol fees.

uni.name: Protocol Revenue Ownership
uni.description: Protocol fees flow through governance-controlled mechanisms. All versions (V2, V3, V4) have admin functions, but the admin IS the governance Timelock. No separate admin can bypass governance for fee changes.

criteria.name: V2 Fee Destination
criteria.description: feeToSetter controls feeTo address. feeToSetter = Timelock (governance-controlled)

criteria.name: V3 Fee Destination
criteria.description: setFeeProtocol() is onlyFactoryOwner. Factory owner = Timelock. Fee range: 10-25% of LP fees

criteria.name: V4 Fee Destination
criteria.description: setProtocolFeeController() is onlyOwner. Owner expected to be Timelock

criteria.name: Revenue Protection
criteria.description: Governance flow: Forum RFC → Snapshot → On-chain proposal → Timelock execution. NO separate admin can bypass governance for fee changes. Fee destinations require on-chain UNI holder vote.

uni.name: Protocol Ownership
uni.description: Uniswap protocol contracts are immutable across all versions. Core pool/pair contracts cannot be upgraded. Governance controls parameter changes but not contract logic.

criteria.name: V2 Pool Immutability
criteria.description: Pairs deployed via CREATE2, deterministic addresses, no upgrade mechanism

criteria.name: V3 Pool Immutability
criteria.description: NoDelegateCall protection prevents proxy-based attacks

criteria.name: V4 Singleton Design
criteria.description: Pool state stored in singleton mapping, no individual pool upgrade mechanism

criteria.name: On-chain Governance
criteria.description: GovernorAlpha: 4% quorum, 1% proposal threshold, ~7 days voting. Timelock: 2-day minimum delay, 30-day maximum, 14-day grace period. All fee changes require on-chain proposal and execution through Timelock.

criteria.name: No Emergency Powers
criteria.description: No pause/freeze functions in V2 Pair, V3 Pool, or V4 PoolManager core contracts. No admin backdoors to steal funds.

criteria.name: No Fund Extraction
criteria.description: No emergency withdrawal or sweep functions in core contracts. Protocol fees can only be collected to governance-approved destinations.

crv.name: Token
crv.description: CRV is a non-upgradeable ERC20 token with an immutable supply logic. Minting follows a deterministic, epoch-based emission schedule enforced by an immutable Minter contract. The token is not deployed behind a proxy and core parameters cannot be arbitrarily changed.

criteria.name: Mint controlled by protocol logic
criteria.description: Minting is restricted to an immutable Minter contract, which can only mint CRV through registered gauges based on user's LP shares or/and locked veCRV

evidences.title: ERC20CRV.vy – only minter can call mint

criteria.name: Immutable token
criteria.description: The CRV token contract is not upgradeable and does not sit behind a proxy. Core token logic is immutable.

criteria.name: Deterministic supply
criteria.description: CRV does not have a hard capped supply, but emissions follow a deterministic yearly epoch schedule with a fixed decay factor of 2^(1/4). Minting rate strictly decreases and cannot be increased.

crv.name: Value Accrual Mechanism
crv.description: CRV accrues value primarily through veCRV. Users lock CRV to obtain veCRV, which boosts gauge emissions, controls protocol parameters, and receives protocol revenues including swap fees and crvUSD interest flows.

criteria.name: Protocol emissions
criteria.description: Liquidity providers earn CRV emissions via gauges, with rewards calculated and minted through the Minter contract.

evidences.title: LPs' rewards are checked by their provided liquidity

criteria.name: veCRV boost
criteria.description: veCRV holders can boost gauge rewards up to 2.5x by voting for gauges, incentivizing long-term locking.

criteria.name: Protocol fees
criteria.description: Admin fees from swaps are routed through FeeCollector and ultimately distributed to veCRV holders.

criteria.name: External revenue dependency
criteria.description: Value accrual partially depends on external systems such as crvUSD controllers and burner contracts, which can change allocation weights via governance.

uni-gio.name: Token
uni-gio.description: UNI has a fixed initial supply of 1 billion tokens with algorithmic inflation capped at 2% per year. The token contract is immutable with no proxy patterns. Minting is controlled by a single minter address which should be verified as the governance Timelock.

criteria.name: Immutable Token
criteria.description: Plain contract with no proxy patterns, no delegatecall, no EIP-1967/UUPS patterns

criteria.name: Unbounded Supply
criteria.evidences: Mint can be called once [per year](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L116) which mints [2% of total supply](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L120). Note that [`mintCap`](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L29) is constant and can not be changed

uni-gio.name: Token Holders
uni-gio.description: UNI is primarily a governance token. There is no programmatic value accrual at the token contract level (no staking, no fee distribution, no buyback). Value accrual comes through governance influence over the fee switch.

subcategories.name: Value Accrual
subcategories.description: Mechanisms through which UNI token holders can capture value from the protocol

criteria.name: Protocol Fees to Holders Through Burn Mechanism
criteria.evidences:
Indirect value accrual happens through a burn mechanism using FirePit and FireJar contracts.

**How it works:** [FeeAdapter](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5E74C9f42EEed283bFf3744fBD1889d398d40867d#code) collects protocol fees by calling [collectProtocol](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-core/blob/d8b1c635c275d2a9450bd6a78f3fa2484fef73eb/contracts/UniswapV3Pool.sol#L848) and sends them to TokenJar. TokenJar has a [release](https://github.com/Uniswap/protocol-fees/blob/8604e4b9aed88bdd6be3a322e19722c40f94be2c/src/TokenJar.sol#L29) function (only callable by FirePit via `onlyReleaser` modifier) that transfers accrued tokens. FirePit's [release function](https://github.com/Uniswap/protocol-fees/blob/8604e4b9aed88bdd6be3a322e19722c40f94be2c/src/releasers/ExchangeReleaser.sol#L45) is permissionless—anyone can call it by burning **4,000 UNI** to receive all accumulated protocol fees in TokenJar.

**The arbitrage:** Rational actors wait until the TokenJar holds more than $24,000 worth of fees (the approximate value of 4,000 UNI) before calling `release`. On the first day post-unification, someone burned 4,000 UNI ($24k) to claim ~$40k in fees, netting $16k profit. Over time, this margin will compress as more people monitor the contract and trigger releases earlier.

**Dynamics:** The 4,000 UNI `threshold` can be changed by governance via the TimeLock contract. If UNI price drops, releases happen more frequently since the burn cost is lower. Governance controls both the threshold and when/how much gets burned.

**Deflationary vs Inflationary:** While burns are deflationary, UNI has a mint function allowing 2% of total supply per year (currently 20M UNI annually for the growth budget, split quarterly—[details here](https://blog.uniswap.org/unification)). For net deflation, burns must exceed 20M UNI/year, which depends on Uniswap transaction volume. Higher volume → more fees → TokenJar fills faster → more frequent burns (at the current 4,000 UNI threshold). If Uniswap maintains dominance and ships good products, the 20M UNI annual spend can be justified by increased trading volume driving more burns.

subcategories.name: Governance Rights
subcategories.description: Rights and mechanisms for UNI holders to participate in protocol governance

criteria.name: Fee Switch
criteria.description: Protocol fee parameters across all Uniswap versions can only be modified by the Timelock contract, which is controlled by UNI token holder governance.
criteria.evidences:
**V2:** Only the [feeToSetter address](https://github.com/Uniswap/v2-core/blob/master/contracts/UniswapV2Factory.sol#L40) can call setFeeTo() to change where protocol fees are sent. You can verify that feeToSetter is set to the [Timelock contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x1a9C8182C09F50C8318d769245beA52c32BE35BC) by calling feeToSetter() on [UniswapV2Factory](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5C69bEe701ef814a2B6a3EDD4B1652CB9cc5aA6f).

**V3:** Each pool's protocol fee percentage (10-25% of LP fees) can be changed by calling [setProtocolFee()](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-core/blob/master/contracts/UniswapV3Pool.sol#L837), which has an onlyFactoryOwner modifier. The [UniswapV3Factory](https://etherscan.io/address/0x1F98431c8aD98523631AE4a59f267346ea31F984) owner is [V3FeeAdapter](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5E74C9f42EEd283bFf3744fBD1889d398d40867d), whose feeSetter is the Timelock contract. Therefore, only Timelock can change V3 protocol fees.

**V4:** The [setProtocolFeeController()](https://github.com/Uniswap/v4-core/blob/main/src/ProtocolFees.sol#L29-L32) function can only be called by the PoolManager owner, which is expected to be the Timelock contract. This controls who can set protocol fees.

criteria.name: Mint
criteria.evidences: Mint function can only be called by `minter`(see [here](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L110)) which is set to [Timelock](https://etherscan.io/address/0x1a9C8182C09F50C8318d769245beA52c32BE35BC#code). Upon following the Timelock contract, it's governed by [GovernorBravoDelegator](https://etherscan.io/address/0x408ED6354d4973f66138C91495F2f2FCbd8724C3#code) which requires approvals from token holders.

uni-gio.name: Protocol
uni-gio.description: Protocol governance, fee mechanisms, and contract immutability across all Uniswap versions. All admin functions are controlled by governance Timelock.

subcategories.name: Value Accrual
subcategories.description: Protocol fee mechanisms and revenue controls across Uniswap versions

criteria.name: Fee Destination
criteria.description: Protocol fees across all Uniswap versions (V2, V3, V4)

evidences.title: UniswapV2Pair.sol
evidences.comment: In Uniswap V2, the fees go to [FeeTo](https://github.com/Uniswap/v2-core/blob/ee547b17853e71ed4e0101ccfd52e70d5acded58/contracts/UniswapV2Pair.sol#L90) address, set inside the [UniswapV2Factory](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5C69bEe701ef814a2B6a3EDD4B1652CB9cc5aA6f#code) contract. Upon checking the `FeeTo` address, it's a TokenJar contract. Read the description inside TokenHolders.

evidences.title: UniswapV3Pool.sol
evidences.comment: In Uniswap V3, the fees go to TokenJar through calling [collectProtocol](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-core/blob/d8b1c635c275d2a9450bd6a78f3fa2484fef73eb/contracts/UniswapV3Pool.sol#L848) which is only callable by [FeeAdapter](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5E74C9f42EEed283bFf3744fBD1889d398d40867d#code) and funds go again to TokenJar. Read the description inside TokenHolders.

evidences.title: ProtocolFees.sol
evidences.comment: setProtocolFeeController() is onlyOwner. Owner expected to be Timelock

subcategories.name: Governance Rights
subcategories.description: Contract immutability, governance mechanisms, and safety protections

criteria.name: Pool Immutability
criteria.description: All Uniswap versions use immutable pool contracts with no upgrade mechanisms.

evidences.title: UniswapV2Pair.sol
evidences.comment: Uses Create2 deployment

evidences.title: UniswapV3Pool.sol
evidences.comment: Uses NoDelegateCall protection

evidences.title: PoolManager.sol
evidences.comment: Uses Singleton design

criteria.name: On-chain Governance
criteria.description: GovernorAlpha: 4% quorum, 1% proposal threshold, ~7 days voting. Timelock: 2-day minimum delay, 30-day maximum, 14-day grace period. All fee changes require on-chain proposal and execution through Timelock.

criteria.name: Revenue Protection
criteria.description: Governance flow: Forum RFC → Snapshot → On-chain proposal → Timelock execution. NO separate admin can bypass governance for fee changes. Fee destinations require on-chain UNI holder vote.

criteria.name: No Emergency Powers
criteria.description: No pause/freeze functions in V2 Pair, V3 Pool, or V4 PoolManager core contracts. No admin backdoors to steal funds.

criteria.name: No Fund Extraction
criteria.description: No emergency withdrawal or sweep functions in core contracts. Protocol fees can only be collected to governance-approved destinations.

uni-gio2.name: Governance
uni-gio2.description: Governance control mechanisms for Uniswap protocol

evidences.title: Governance Flow
evidences.comment: Users create a proposal on a forum, then on an off-chain snapshot and later, on-chain, after which, delay occurs before the execution. [RFC](https://gov.uniswap.org/) -> [Snapshot Poll](https://snapshot.box/#/s:uniswapgovernance.eth) -> [GovernorBravoDelegator](https://etherscan.io/address/0x408ed6354d4973f66138c91495f2f2fcbd8724c3#code) -> [Timelock](https://etherscan.io/address/0x1a9C8182C09F50C8318d769245beA52c32BE35BC#code)

criteria.name: Role Accountability
criteria.description: All critical roles flow through governance-controlled contracts, ensuring UNI holders maintain ultimate control over the protocol.
criteria.evidences:
**V2Factory:**
feeToSetter role is held by Timelock contract. Only feeToSetter can call setFeeTo() to change where protocol fees are sent.

**V3Factory:**
Factory owner is V3FeeAdapter, whose feeSetter is Timelock. Only Timelock can change V3 protocol fees via setProtocolFee().

**V4PoolManager:**
PoolManager owner is expected to be Timelock. Only owner can call setProtocolFeeController() to control who can set protocol fees.

**UNI Token:**
Minter role is held by Timelock contract. Only minter can call mint function.

Since Timelock is controlled by GovernorAlpha, all operations are controlled by UNI holders.

criteria.name: Upgrade Sovereignty
criteria.description: Token contract is immutable with no proxy patterns, no delegatecall, no EIP-1967/UUPS patterns

evidences.comment: Mint can be called once [per year](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L116) which mints [2% of total supply](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L120). Note that [`mintCap`](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L29) is constant and can not be changed. [Minter](https://github.com/Uniswap/governance/blob/eabd8c71ad01f61fb54ed6945162021ee419998e/contracts/Uni.sol#L111) is set to [Timelock](https://etherscan.io/address/0x1a9C8182C09F50C8318d769245beA52c32BE35BC#code) governed by token holders.

criteria.name: Censorship Immunity
criteria.description: No blacklist, whitelist, or pause functions in UNI token contract. Transfers cannot be censored.

evidences.title: Uni.sol - no censorship
evidences.comment: Standard ERC20 with no admin controls over transfers

criteria.name: Upgrade Sovereignty
criteria.description: All Uniswap Pair contracts and Timelock are non-upgradeable, where as GovernorBravoDelegator is upgradeable

evidences.title: UniswapV2Pair.sol
evidences.comment: Uses Create2 deployment

evidences.title: UniswapV3Pool.sol
evidences.comment: Uses NoDelegateCall protection

evidences.title: PoolManager.sol
evidences.comment: Uses Singleton design

evidences.title: GovernorBravoDelegator.sol
evidences.comment: Admin(who can upgrade) is set to TimeLock contract which again requires governance flow to go through.

criteria.name: Gated Access Control
criteria.description: No pause/freeze functions in V2 Pair, V3 Pool, or V4 PoolManager core contracts. No admin backdoors to steal funds. No emergency withdrawal or sweep functions.

evidences.title: Core contracts review
evidences.comment: No emergency powers or fund extraction mechanisms in core contracts

uni-gio2.name: Value Accrual
uni-gio2.description: Value accrual mechanisms for token holders

criteria.name: Accrual (Active)
criteria.description: Protocol fees across all Uniswap versions (V2, V3, V4) flow to governance-controlled destinations (TokenJar). However, value accrual is only indirect through burn mechanism - anyone can burn 4,000 UNI to claim accumulated protocol fees from TokenJar via FirePit. FeeAdapter collects protocol fees by calling collectProtocol and sends them to TokenJar. The 4,000 UNI threshold can be changed by governance via Timelock.

evidences.title: UniswapV2Pair.sol
evidences.comment: V2 fees go to FeeTo address which is set to TokenJar

evidences.title: UniswapV3Pool.sol
evidences.comment: V3 fees are collected via calling `collectProtocol` on the pool contract from [V3FeeAdapter](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5E74C9f42EEd283bFf3744fBD1889d398d40867d#code), which calls `collectProtocol` and passes TokenJar parameter as recipient.

evidences.title: ProtocolFees.sol
evidences.comment: V4 protocol fee controller set by Timelock

criteria.name: Treasury Ownership
criteria.description: Fee destinations require on-chain UNI holder vote through governance. NO separate admin can bypass governance for fee changes.

evidences.title: Governance process
evidences.comment: Governance flow: Forum RFC → Snapshot → On-chain proposal → Timelock execution

criteria.name: Mechanism Control
criteria.description: Token holders control the fee switch and burn threshold(in TokenPit) through governance proposals.

evidences.title: Timelock governance
evidences.comment: All parameter changes require Timelock execution controlled by UNI holders
